result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian Anthony Ewert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Huber Privileges and Good Time credit granted.    Court has no objection to sentence being served in another jurisdiction provided the Defendant can make the appropriate arrangements.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  Defendant is prohibited from having any contact with S.G. unless contact is specifically authorized by the Supervising Agent.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons, including any firearms
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian Anthony Ewert

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 2:25 PM: Defendant Brian Anthony Ewert in court with attorney David C. Rashid.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Resolution recited by ADA.  Def and counsel confirm resolution.    Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea:  NC  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Statement by Def:  Yes.  The Court:  Accepts resolution.  9 Mos WCJ - I/S - GT and Huber if revoked - No TS credit.  S/W - 12 mos probation.  Conditions:  AODA and any follow thru,  the defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  No contact with S.G. unless specifically authorized by supervising agent; Court Costs - 60 DTP or PP; No possession of any dangerous weapons including firearms; DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice.  Appeal Rights Given.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 12-04-2015 02:00 pm

Case Called @ 2:10 PM:  Defendant Brian Anthony Ewert in court, appearing pro se.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  ADA Serves another copy of Complaint - Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def wants counsel - referred to SPD for eligibility process.  Def to complete eligibility today prior to leaving.   NGP entered by Court.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 10:40 am.
